intro: Marsdenia mollis, commonly known as the silver vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite and have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Marsdenia mollis is often cultivated as a ground cover or in hanging baskets due to its adaptability and aesthetic value.
